titleStmt.title: A short discourse (recommended to all our English divines) concerning the death of the witnesses in general, and the two witnesses in particular; : plainly shewing ...
A short discourse (recommended to all our English divines) concerning the death of the witnesses in general, and the two witnesses in particular; : plainly shewing ...

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in: Lambeth Place Library, London, England.

First, the chief and true reason of their death. -- Secondly, the manner how they are to be slain. -- Thirdly, the place where. -- Fourthly, the time when. -- Fifthly, by whom they are to be slain. -- Sixthly, the true reason why they are overcome, and why in particular by a war. -- Seventhly, who they are, and that they have already been slain. -- The conclusion.
